note.p: Career: Served in the Australian Army Medical Corps (World War 1); Walter and Eliza Hall Institute, Melbourne (1920); Medical Research Officer, Bombay; returned to Hall Institute (1927); Lecturer, School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine (1929-1940); Consulting Physician, Australian Military Forces (1940-1942); Director of Medicine and Chairman, Combined Advisory Committee on Tropical Medicine, South Pacific Area (1942-1946); Professor of Tropical Medicine, London (1946); resigned on health grounds (1948)
Memberships: FRCP; Royal Society of Tropical Health and Hygience (President 1951)
Obituaries: Biographical Memoirs of Fellows of the Royal Society 1966 vol 12 pp 123-145, plate, by John Boyd
